videos.transcript: Magic Kingdom is taking some unexpected twists and turns next year, but in today's ultimate guide, we're going to make sure you're prepared for a 2026 visit to this ultra popular park, no matter what changes are thrown your way. Hey everybody, it's AJ for Disney Food Blog. Welcome to Magic Kingdom, a place of castle dining, barberh shop quartets, and construction walls apparently. But I'm getting ahead of myself here. We're going to talk about what's going down in the kingdom this year so that you're either a ready for that 2026 vacation that you've been dreaming up for the longest time or b at the very least well informed and ready to hear all the piping hot tea. Guess we should get this can of worms out of the way first. Magic Kingdom is going to look real different this year in good ways and in kind of awkward ways. So, let me tell you about the key pros and cons for a Magic Kingdom 2026 visit right now to help you better prepare for the future. The cons, lots of construction, like lots. The thick of the construction is coming from the back side of the park, which is already kind of a blemish for Magic Kingdom at the moment. Tom Sawyer Island and Liberty Square Riverboat permanently closed on July 7th, 2025 to accommodate the construction of Piston Peak National Park based on the movie Cars and the future Disney Villains Land. Both are going to be awesome new additions in the future, providing more rides, more attractions, more shopping and dining and all around more memory making. But the problem is we don't know when these new lands are going to be opening up shop. And our best guess is years down the road. That means Magic Kingdom is going to have fewer things to offer here for a little bit. Doesn't mean you're going to get bored in the slightest. There's still plenty to see and do. It's just good to set expectations and know that this back half of Magic Kingdom is going to be way less immersive for a while, and there are fewer Btier attractions, which can mean more crowding in other places around Liberty Square and Frontier Land for the time being. The next point's a bit of a half and half. Half pro, halfcon, depending on when you visit. Attractions like Big Thunder Mountain Railroad and Buzz Lightyear Space Ranger Spin will also be closed at the start of next year, but they've already been closed for a good long while throughout 2025. While we don't know when they're slated to reopen, we do know that Disney plans to reopen them sometime in 2026. And that's great if your vacation just so happens to align with those reopening plans. But for the release of this video, there are no exact dates for us to go off of yet. So, you might want to wait before you lock in your 2026 vacation dates, just until we hear about something more concrete for those refreshed rides. Or you can just lock in your trip anyways and cross your fingers without getting your hopes too high up. Another thing to be on your toes about are potential closures for Carousel of Progress since Disney recently announced they'd be adding a new scene at the start of the show sometime in the future featuring a Walt Disney animatronic like you can find over at Disneyland now. And a big one to be on the lookout for. Cinderella Castle will be getting a paint job in the future, switching her back to her OG blue and white colors. Lots of Disney fans are thrilled to hear about that one. But whenever it does happen, expect some serious scrims and construction to pop up around the castle there. No matter when your Magic Kingdom visit is slated to happen, there are new things that started up in Magic Kingdom in 2025 that you can check out for the first time ever next year if you haven't already gotten the chance to see them. The two key new things, Disney Starlight Dream the Night Away parade is dazzling the Magic Kingdom streets each night, featuring bright and glowing floats with new and classic Disney characters alike. The parade tends to happen twice nightly, once before and once after Happily Ever After. But it's best to check your My Disney Experience app and find out the exact times that the show will commence on the evening of your visit. And Beacon Barrel is the new Pirates of the Caribbean themed interactive lounge over in Adventure Land with tropical drinks and interesting bites and lots of immersive moments that help expand the Pirates of the Caribbean storyline. This lounge is small but mighty popular, so you'll need to prioritize those advanced dining reservations 60 days before your visit if it's a priority spot for you. Magic Kingdom on a normal day is a great time, but during a Magic Kingdom special event, you could really plus up your visit with limited time entertainment and potentially shorter ride lines. We got a full Disney World 12 month calendar already fixed up and ready to send your way. All you need to do is scan the QR code you see on the screen or click on the link in the description for Disneyfoodblog.com/wdwcal right after this. But for now, we're going to stick with the Magic Kingdom stuff since, you know, MK's the star of our show today. After hours events are returning to Magic Kingdom on select nights from January 12th to July 27th, 2026. I'm becoming a real big fan of these events. Well, I shouldn't even say becoming. I've been a huge fan of these events for a long time. Prices for them can be as expensive, if not more expensive, than a regular day ticket. But capacity for after hours is limited, meaning you'll have access to over 20 Magic Kingdom attractions, including the super popular ones like Tron and Seven Dwarfs Mine Train without all the extra waiting around and Lightning Lane planning. And guess what? Ice cream, popcorn, and drinks are included with admission, too. So, anytime you're starting to feel hungry, grab a snack and don't think twice. Magic Kingdom's After Hours are ultra special because they also come with an exclusive fireworks show, Disney Enchantment. And that's doubly awesome because that means you'll get double the fireworks action with your after hours ticket. Disney After Hours at Magic Kingdom begins at 10:00 p.m. and lasts for 3 hours, ending at 1:00 a.m. And guests with event tickets are allowed to enter the park as early as 7, meaning you'll still be able to watch the general admission Happily Ever After Fireworks show as well. You can also meet Mickey Mouse at Town Square Theater and meet Disney princesses at Princess Fairy Tale Hall during after hours if you'd like to prioritize some of those popular characters, too. So, lots to do during this event, but way fewer people to get in your way. Super super win. Also, if you're there in the summer, then that means you get to ride everything in Magic Kingdom, shorter wait times, tons of free snacks, and the sun isn't trying to kill you. This is definitely a win-winw win-win. If you're staying at a deluxe level Disney resort during your vacation, then you might already have a version of after hours in your back pocket. Extended evening hours are available for deluxe level resort guests only on certain nights at certain parks, giving you two extra hours in the park after it closes for the general public. You will still need a general admission ticket to the parks to use this perk. And you're not going to get all the backto-back all-inclusive snacks, nor will you get the extra fireworks show. But hey, 2 hours more of park attractions and even fewer crowds is not too shabby when you have that option at your disposal already. Just be extra mindful of when and where extended evening hours are happening by checking up on them via the Disney World Hours and events calendar or by downloading our updated DFB 12-month calendar, which I just talked about earlier, and that might even be easier for you to navigate. Magic Kingdom also likes to celebrate all the little fun moments throughout the year that you won't need to make any extra purchases for beyond your theme park tickets. You might find some specialty green treats on the bakery shelves around St. Patrick's Day or see the Easter Bunny, Mr. and Mrs. Bunny actually meet and greet with guests around Easter weekend. Or if you don't mind Braving the Crowds, Magic Kingdom also does specialty evening fireworks around the 4th of July, too. Disney's Celebrate America, a Fourth of July concert in the sky, will play not once, not twice, but on three different nights of the Independence Day holiday weekend in 2026 from July 3rd to the 5th. Keep in mind that this fireworks show will replace Happily Ever After on those nights. So, if you'd rather see Happily Ever After and maybe have, I don't know, fewer people to worry about, then hang tight and book your Magic Kingdom Day post 4th of July weekend. More crowd-heavy celebrations happen in Magic Kingdom leading up to New Year's Day. Magic Kingdom celebrates the New Year countdown with their exclusive Fantasy in the Sky fireworks show in 2025. So, that means your kids are going to get to sleep in these non-exlosive probably bombs surrounded by hundreds of minion eyes because who wouldn't get a good night's sleep with lots of little yellow dudes gathered around you? Portoino Bay is also home to various upscale dining options with a focus on Italian cuisine. There's Madela's Restaurante for table service, Trateria del Porto, Splendido Bar and Grill, and Sal's Market Deli for quick and casual dining. The Thirsty Fish for light bites and drinks, a gelato, and a Starbucks. Just assume that if you're staying at a Universal Hotel, there'll never be a Starbucks too far away. But my favorite restaurant at Portoino is Biche Restorante, which is a dimly lit, sophisticated restaurant that features Italian inspired dishes with handmade pastas and seasonal risottos. Now, this resort is pretty spread out, so getting place to place can be a little bit of a trick, especially if your room's on one of those outer wings on the far opposite side of where the lobby is. That being said, this resort still has a clear walking path up to the Citywalk area that'll take you about 15 to 20 minutes at an average walking pace. Otherwise, shuttles and boats are available for you to use, too. Portoino Bay Resort is also home to three pools, but the beach pool is the main one with the actual sand around the perimeter and a Roman aqueduct themed water slide. And much like Disney's Grand Fian Resort, Portoino Bay also has premium spa services in case you need a little more pampering while you're on vacation. I love how Portoino Bay can combine character, whimsy, and sophistication into one big hotel package that's good for the whole family. But I will say be prepared to budget for this all ages luxury stay since the cheapest standard room prices often range between 700 to 800 per night. Okay, we are at Teraluna's twin sister, Stella Nova. Stellanova is another brand new prime value hotel in the Epic Universe area. And upon first glance, it looks almost identical to Teraluna. And in a lot of ways, it's very similar. They both got modern amenities, fitness centers, lobby bars, quick service restaurants, galactic theming inside the rooms, similar standard room setups, a spacious pool, but the two key differences between them are what makes Stellenova stand out. The first, there's a designated walking path to Epic Universe from Stellanova that doesn't require you to play multiple rounds of Frogger like you'll have to do when you're crossing over from Teral Luna. We tested this path out ourselves and it takes around 5 minutes to walk from the front of the hotel to the crosswalk that'll take you across the street straight up into the entrance of Epic Universe. Not too shabby, especially when you consider that average prices for a room at Stelenova tend to range at 200 to 230 per night. The other key difference, the overall space theming inside tends to be more drastic and dramatic, while the theming in Teraluna is more casual and subdued. Now, you might prefer the casual theming of Terra Luna, but we really do love how Stella has an entrance that makes you feel like you're entering a black hole and the stars on the ceiling and the hallways and even the rooms with the darker and enhanced space theme. This is already probably obvious since I mentioned it when we talked about Teraluna before, but Stellanova is only within walking distance to Epic Universe. If you want to travel to the other Universal theme parks, you're going to have to take the shuttle system, which is about a 15-minute ride over. Not horrible, but still something to keep in mind when planning out your day-to-day itineraries. All right, Helios Grand, we have officially granted you the title of best Universal Hotel for 2026. So, give yourself a round of applause. There's a lot of good stuff to say about the new signature Helios Grand. Team members at Helios refer to this hotel as the crown jewel of Epic Universe's Celestial Park. And that's because the hotel is actually situated inside Celestial Park, making it the first ever Universal Orlando Hotel to have a designated entrance directly into a theme park. So, if you're wanting to get to Epic Universe with absolutely zero travel time, Helios Grand is going to be your go-to resort. And I will tell you, having stayed there, it makes a massive difference to just be able to walk directly into the theme park. You don't think it's going to be that big a deal? It's a big deal. This hotel is heavily influenced by the Mediterranean decor and constellations that create Celestial Park, making that transition from hotel to Epic incredibly fluid. You've got quite a few dining opportunities in Helios Grand. But our two favorites have got to be the Flora Tivera, the full service restaurant serving up Mediterranean comfort foods for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. and the rooftop bar called Bar Helios, which serves up small bites, handmade cocktails, and 360 degree views above the park. The thing that I don't get about these places, though, is that they don't have any blenders, so they can't make frozen drinks, which was kind of upsetting to me. I don't know why. Anyway, Helios Grand also has a spacious zero entry pool complete with underwater speakers, poolside cabanas, a hot tub, poolside movies, recreational activities, etc. Now, when it comes to room options, you got a little bit of everything to choose from here. The standard rooms here sleep up to four guests or five if you request a rollaway bed. And these will be your cheapest Helios Grand options with prices ranging around 550 to 650 per night. You've also got your club level rooms, your various suites, your rooms with views across the theme park. But the coolest rooms at Helios Grand are the How to Train Your Dragon kids suites where little ones can take to the skies and rest amongst dragons in a colorful room inspired by the Viking village of Burke. But sleeping amongst dragons will cost you a pretty penny. Don't be surprised if you find this suite well over $2,000 per night. As cool as Helios Grand is, keep in mind that despite the high price you're paying for a room here, you're not going to get the Express Pass perks for Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios like you will when you book a room at the other signature level hotels. And that could be a massive deterrent for you. Certainly is for me since the free express passes really do help rationalize the price of those signature hotels. That being said, Helios Grand still has all the other Universal Hotel perks like early theme park entry on certain days, complimentary shuttle service over to the other parks, and of course that nifty dedicated entrance straight on into Epic Universe. So, we're still going to claim it as today's best Universal Hotel winner for the newness, the fun immersive kids suites, the dining options, and the Epic Universe convenience. But you may still prefer one of the other Universal hotels that are cheaper and/or have more theme park perks for the other Universal parks beyond Epic. Okay, we have made it to the end of our list and there's so much more we want to tell you about your next year's trip to Universal Orlando. If you're willing to lend your ear for a little bit longer, go ahead and check out one of our other Universal videos next, like the 50 new Universal Orlando tips for 2026. These are awesome. They are brand new. I can't wait for you to hear them. And don't forget to download the free Universal Hotel guide ASAP over at disneyfoodblog.com/universal ranks. Thanks for listening everyone and thanks for watching. As always, this is AJ for Disney Food Blog and we'll see you real soon.

videos.title: Vegas Baby! üé∞‚úàÔ∏è
videos.transcript: This is one of the only places in America you can legally light up between flights. Jackpots, restaurant music, ad screens, gate announcements stacked on top of each other. People miss flights here more than they'll admit because time slips when you're gambling and a boarding call blends into the noise. The design sells distraction and it works. Even if you never touch a machine, you're inside the illusion from the moment your shoes hit the carpet.

When you're going in January, I think you just need to pack for all different weather situations. So, definitely make sure you do pack stuff for if it's cold, but maybe have layered kind of things. So, have a lot of t-shirts in case it is a little bit warmer, but bring hoodies and things that you can put on over the top. I would bring a coat or a jacket because I definitely did need that in January this year. The one thing I will say is great about January though, you've got the Festival of the Arts in Epcot, which I absolutely love. And when it is colder, I just find that I can do much longer days because I find the heat is what really takes out of you. When it's very, very hot, it makes you more tired and exhausted. When it's cold, I feel like I can just totally do all day in the parks and it doesn't make me feel as exhausted. So, that is a massive plus to coming in January. D West is asking, "Best quick service meal in Animal Kingdom." In terms of quick service, I've got two answers. One is what I believe to be the best and the second is what is my favorite cuz those are two different things. I think the best is Satuli Canteen. It's not actually my type of food. I do love the cheeseburger pods, but the bowls that they do where you can have like noodles or rice, I think sweet potato, and then you have chicken and beef and stuff. I think it's a really, really good meal because it's very different to other quick service. It looks very good. All of my friends rave about it. It's just not my particular type of food, but I would say that is probably generally acknowledged to be the best. I think I'd probably have to say Yakin Yeti quick service, but I also love Flame Tree Barbecue. It's kind of a toss up between the two. I like Yaketti for breakfast quick service and probably Flame Tree Barbecue are like better for lunch. Kim is asking, "What was your favorite new snack you have tried this trip?" It is the churros at Nomad Lounge. Nomad Lounge churros are absolutely incredible. Go there and have coffee and churros. Honestly, you won't regret it. That definitely is my favorite snack that I've had. Jenna is asking, "How does ordering items to your hotel work? I.e. Amazon, takeouts, etc., do you wait in the lobby?" Yes. So, if ever I order anything from Uber Eats and that can include items because over here in the States, you can get stuff from Target or um Lowe's and Best Buy and all places like that, they will deliver through Uber Eats. So, I ordered a fan last year. I ordered my memory card, which I picked up yesterday. So, if it's anything like Uber Eatats where you literally order it and it comes kind of there and then you can do that at your own hotel or a different hotel that you're visiting, you just obviously have to sit and wait for it to get there. And I always just put in the instructions meet outside lobby and then they just come and you pick it up. If it's Amazon, then you would get that delivered to your own resort. Just bear in mind that there will be a package handling fee, which I think is $6 if you get anything like a package delivered, something that you're not picking up yourself at the lobby. If you do order anything, I've had Eron Condrin packages delivered before, just make sure within the address that you put hold for guests arriving and then the date that you're arriving. That's quite important if you're ordering something ahead of time. This is a really nice question. Main Street Calling said, "What does a Disney holiday mean to you?" The short version would be happiness. A Disney holiday means happiness to me. It absolutely is my happy place. I know that's like a cliche thing that people say and you get it on t-shirts saying this is my happy place, but it really truly is for me. I've been coming here for 23 years. This is my 37th trip that I'm on currently and I just absolutely love it. Since I was 19, I started coming and it is literally kind of been with me then through all of these years. Everything that has gone on in my life. All of my friends have got really into it. fact that all of them love coming to Disney and some of them have bought DVC. They're out here like Kate and Becky have been out here while we were. My mom has now been on trips with me. Paul absolutely loves it as well. It is just so special to me and it just feels like my second home. It really does. I love it so much. Being here is just total happiness and peace to me. So, that's a really nice question, I think, to end this vlog on and we're going to answer the rest of those questions. Like I said, there's plenty more. Some of them were for Cla or for both of us and we will answer those in our next Q&A session. Thank you guys so much for letting me have all these questions on Instagram. You always deliver with loads of questions whenever I ask and I love answering them. A huge thank you to everybody who has come up to say hi on this trip. We have met so many of you. I feel like this trip is probably the most people that I have ever talked to and I love it. Please don't ever hesitate to come over. I know some of you sometimes worry that you're um disturbing what I'm doing. Please don't ever worry about that. I love chatting to you, finding out what you've been doing on your trip, putting a face to names that I see in the comments section. I really do love it. And just a huge thank you to all of you for watching these vlogs. Everything you guys do, I really do appreciate each and every one of you so much. And I know all of you guys just love Disney as well. Whether you've been on a trip or you are hoping to do one at some point, some of you, I know, don't even plan on doing a Disney trip, but you just love watching the vlogs and I just love making these vlogs for you. So, a huge thank you to all of you and thanks for taking the time out of your day to watch this one. If you did enjoy it, please do give it a thumbs up. That helps other people to find it. I hope you're all having a great day and I will see you in the next one. Bye. [Music] [Music]

Although Spaceship Perth itself is closed for refurbishment, but we'll get a little bit of a Spaceship Perth fix hopefully by visiting the new lounge, which I've never done before. We're also going to get to see the new Starlight Parade in the Magic Kingdom. That's the new nighttime parade, and there hasn't been one for such a long time. I used to love the Main Street Electrical Parade and Spectro Magic. I've been visiting Walt Disney World for 23 years now and it's been such a long time since we've had a nighttime parade. I'm really excited to see that. Tron is having a new overlay in the Magic Kingdom with different lighting, different music, and we're going to be experiencing that. There is just so much coming up. So, do make sure you subscribe if you're not already because you're not going to want to miss that. In this video, I'm going to take you through everything that I'm going to be packing for this trip. So, if you have a trip to Walt Disney World coming up or a trip anywhere for that matter, packing tips can always be useful. There's so many different things that you do need for a Disney World trip. And like I said, I've been going for a long time. This is my 37th trip, I think, I worked out to Walt Disney World. So, over the years, I've really refined what I do need, what I don't need. I used to pack all kinds of things that were just pointless. So, hopefully this will help you if you have a trip coming up or you're hoping to book one.
